body:
<!-- This form is for bug reports and feature requests ONLY! 

If you're looking for help check [Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/kubernetes) and the [troubleshooting guide](https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/debug-application-cluster/troubleshooting/).
-->

**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?**:

> Uncomment only one, leave it on its own line: 
>
> /kind bug
/kind feature


**What happened**:
Run e2e conformance tests remotely on an already-running IPv6-only cluster.
Some tests fail where there is an attempt to connect using an <IPv6-address>:<port>
endpoint, where there are no brackets around the IPv6 address. The IPv6 address
needs to be bracketized in order to distinguish the colons in the address from the
colon preceding the port number, e.g. [2001:db8::10]:6443.

**What you expected to happen**:
e2e tests should used brackets around IPv6 addresses when the addresses
appear in an <IPv6-address>:<port> endpoint, e.g. [2001:db8::10]:6443.

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:
Run e2e conformance tests remotely on an already-running IPv6-only cluster.

**Anything else we need to know?**:

**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`): Latest master
- Cloud provider or hardware configuration**: VirtualBox cluster, Ubuntu 16.04.1 host, CentOS 7 guests
- OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): CentOS 7
- Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`): 3.10.0-514.26.2.el7.x86_64 #1 SMP Tue Jul 4 15:04:05 UTC 2017 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
- Install tools:
- Others:

labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a new feature.
labels.name: kind/feature

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG Network.
labels.name: sig/network

title: e2e tests need to use brackets around IPv6 addresses for IP:port
